# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the solution to your problem in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]+" => "_")
end
```

This function works by first converting `col` into lower case, and then stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip()` function. After that it replaces all spaces (" ") and hyphens ("-") with underscores ("_"), which is the preferred format for column names in databases like SQL.

To test this function you can use following code:

```julia
println(clean_column(" My Column ")) # Outputs: my_column
println(clean_column("Another-Column"))  # Outputs: another_column
println(clean_column("LastOne")) # Outputs: lastone
```
